thread.title: Police ID man killed in North Portland as Gerardo Granados-Marin
thread.title_full: Police ID man killed in North Portland as Gerardo Granados-Marin | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Police ID man killed in North Portland as Gerardo Granados-Marin
text:
Police have identified the man killed Monday in North Portland as 33-year-old Gerardo Granados-Marin.
Granados-Marin died from "multiple sharp force" injuries, according to the Oregon State Medical Examiner. Police found him Monday night bleeding from traumatic injuries in 5500 block of North Columbia Court. He died at the scene.
Police have not yet identified a suspect in what is being called a homicide.
This was the fourth homicide in four days east of the Willamette River and inside city limits, and the sixth in over a week.
"That's a lot of violent crime we're responding to," Pete Simpson, Portland Police spokesman, said Monday night.
Detectives are asking anyone with information about this homicide to contact Detective Bryan Steed at 503-823-0395 or bryan.steed@portlandoregon.gov , or Detective Michele Michaels at 503-823-0692 or michele.michaels@portlandoregon.gov .
